snippet: Pete Wilson has fought a lot of tough battles in almost eight years as Governor of California. But his toughest fight has always been with the polls.    Despite his respectable successes in pushing through legislative programs, despite his mostly ...
lead_paragraph: Pete Wilson has fought a lot of tough battles in almost eight years as Governor of California. But his toughest fight has always been with the polls. Despite his respectable successes in pushing through legislative programs, despite his mostly middle-of-the-road brand of Republicanism and despite his impressive come-from-behind re-election victory in 1994, he has never gotten very high job performance ratings from his constituents.
abstract: Californians, who have never given Gov Pete Wilson very high approval ratings, are decidedly more positive in latest Field Poll, but they remain clearly against him seeking the Presidency in 2000; he steps down in January; photo (S)

headline.main: Political Briefing; Wilson's Love-Him, Love-Him-Not Polls
